packagecontents: One IBR600B series IoT router with an embedded business-class LTE modem featuring an integrated mounting plate
Two external mobile broadband modem antennas (SMA)
imageurls.getConnect:
Connecting a Wired WAN

Connect your Ethernet WAN source to the WAN port (Port WAN is default WAN. All ports are LAN/WAN switchable).
imageurls.insertSim:
Insert an Activated SIM

  1. Unscrew and remove the SIM cover from the router.

  2. Insert the card into the SIM1 slot, metal contacts down and notch in. It will click into place. Depress again to remove.

  3. Insert the secondary SIM card into the SIM2 slot if desired.


  4. Replace the SIM door cover and secure with the screws.
imageurls.attachAnttena:
Attach the Antennas

  1. Attach the two LTE and WiFi antennas (included), and optional GPS antenna (not included), to the connectors. The antennas are jointed, which enables positioning for optimal signal reception.

    • NOTE: Cellular antennas include RP-SMA connectors (pin in the center on the antenna) while WiFi antennas include SMA connectors (pin in the center on the device connection point). Ensure you connect the correct antennas to their applicable connection locations.




     
  1. Do not over-tighten. The maximum recommended torque is 4 in-lbs.

  1. Angle the antennas for optimal signal reception.
imageurls.poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Insert four-pin end of the AC adapter to the four-pin port on the router.
  2. Plug the adapter into an electrical socket.
imageurls.productSpecification:
The following features are delivered through the hardware.

  • WAN:

    • Embedded 4G LTE modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover)
    • Dual-modem capable with optional COR Extensibility Dock and compatible MC400 modular modem
    • One 10/100/1000 Ethernet port (WAN or LAN), one 10/100 (WAN or LAN)

  • LAN:

    • One 10/100/1000 Ethernet port (WAN or LAN), one 10/100 Ethernet port (WAN or LAN)

  • Ports:

    • Power
    • 2-wire GPIO
    • Two ethernet LAN or WAN
    • Two (2) cellular antenna connectors (SMA)
    • Two (2) WiFi connectors* (RP-SMA), 5 dBi gain)
    • Cradlepoint COR Extensibility Dock Port/custom cable Port (15-pin) with 4 GPIOs, power input, ignition sensing & 5 V out

  • Temperature:

    • -20 °C to 60 °C (-4 °F to 140 °F) operating
    • -30 °C to 70 °C (-22 °F to 158 °F) storage

  • Humidity (non-condensing):

    • 5% to 95% operating
    • 5% to 95% storage

  • Power:

    • DC input steady state voltage range: 9–33 VDC (requires inline fuse for vehicle installations)
      • For 9–24 VDC installations, use a 3 A fuse
      • For > 24 VDC installations, use a 2.5 A fuse
    • Reverse polarity and transient voltage protection per ISO 7637-2
    • Ignition sensing (automatic ON and time-delay OFF)
    • Power Consumption (@25ºC):
      • IBR600B
        • Idle: 1.98 W
        • Max: 12.24 W
      • IBR650B
        • Idle: 1.5 W
        • Max: 10.08 W

packagecontents: One AER2200 with embedded LTE Advanced (600M) or LTE Advanced Pro (1200M) modem
Two or Four LTE universal modem antennas (SMA). (Number of antennas vary depending on the model)
Four rubber feet for desk mounting
getConnect:
Connecting a Wired WAN

Connect your Ethernet WAN source to the WAN port of the AER2200 (Port WAN is default WAN. All ports are LAN/WAN switchable).
insertSim:
Insert an Activated SIM


If setting up cellular connectivity, do the following:
 

  1. Remove the modem door covering the SIM slots.
  1. Insert an activated 2FF-sized SIM card with metal contacts face up and notch in, into the SIM 1 slot. It will click into place. Depress again to remove, if necessary.
  1. Insert a secondary/backup, activated SIM card into the SIM 2 slot, if required
  1. Replace the modem door and secure with the modem door screw.
    • NOTE: The modem door cover must be on the device or the embedded modem will not power on.


 

Insert External MC400 Modem (optional)

  1. The AER2200 has a slot for second, removable modem (MC400).
  1. Insert an activated 2FF-sized SIM card into the MC400 modem, metal contacts down, notch end first.
  1. Remove the modem door on the AER2200 device.
  1. Slide the MC400 modem into the available modem slot, USB plug first, with the Cradlepoint logo facing up.
  1. Replace the MC400 modem door cover.
    • NOTE: Remove the plastic SMA covers from the modem door cover for the additional antenna ports on the modem.
    1. Secure with the door cover screw (beneath the device).
attachAnttena:
Attach the Antennas


  1. Attach the four WiFi antennas (included) and two or four (depending on model) cellular modem antennas (included) to the connectors.

    • NOTE: Cellular antennas include RP-SMA connectors (pin in the center on the antenna) while WiFi antennas include SMA connectors (pin in the center on the device connection point). Ensure you connect the correct antennas to their applicable connection locations.

  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base of the antenna to connect to the device.
  1. Do not over-tighten. The maximum recommended torque is 4 in-lbs (typically this is “finger tight”).
  1. Angle the antennas for optimal signal reception.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
  2. Switch the device to ON (O = OFF, – = ON). The LED lights will begin lighting up.
